\n\nCheesy Herb-Stuffed Chicken Breast@T.recipe:
Ingredients:

- 2 slices of whole wheat bread
- 1 tomato, sliced
- Avocado, diced
- 4 slices of bacon, cooked
- 1 tablespoon of mayonnaise

Instructions:

1. Toast the 2 slices of whole wheat bread.

2. Spread one slice with mayonnaise.

3. Top the mayonnaise slice of bread with the diced avocado, slices of tomato, and bacon.

4. Place the other slice of bread on top to form a sandwich.

5. Slice the sandwich in two and serve. Enjoy!
\n\nCheesy Herb-Stuffed Chicken Breast@T.title: Cheesy Herb-Stuffed Chicken Breast

\n\nFestive Mexican-Style Salad Bowl@Tue.recipe:
Ingredients:
-1 apple
-3 slices of cooked bacon
-1/4 cup of feta cheese
-1/2 cup of arugula
-1 teaspoon of olive oil
-1 teaspoon of honey
-1 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar

Instructions:
1. Rinse and core the apple and cut into small cubes.
2. In a medium sized bowl, mix together the apple cubes, bacon, feta cheese, and arugula.
3. In a separate small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, honey, and balsamic vinegar to make the dressing.
4. Pour the dressing on top of the salad and mix together to combine.
5. Serve and enjoy!
\n\nFestive Mexican-Style Salad Bowl@Tue.title: Festive Mexican-Style Salad Bowl

\n\nYou-licious Veggie Wrap@Tue Dec 05 2.recipe:
Ingredients:
1 can tuna
1 avocado
1 tomato
1 red onion

Instructions:

1. Drain and flake the tuna into a bowl.

2. Slice the avocado, tomato, and red onion into small pieces, and combine them into the bowl with the tuna.

3. Mix the ingredients together.

4. Form the mixture into patties.

5. Heat a pan over medium heat and drizzle with oil.

6. Place the patties in the pan and cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side, or until golden brown.

7. Serve with a side of your favorite green salad. Enjoy!
\n\nYou-licious Veggie Wrap@Tue Dec 05 2.title: You-licious Veggie Wrap

\n\nBacon and Egg Lunch Omelet@Tue Dec 0.recipe:
Ingredients:
- Bacon
- Eggs
- Olive Oil
- Salt
- Pepper
- Shredded Cheese

Instructions:

1. Preheat a large skillet over medium-high heat.

2. Add bacon to the skillet and cook until crispy, about 10 minutes. Remove cooked bacon from the skillet and set aside.

3. In the same skillet, add a tablespoon of olive oil.

4. Crack the eggs into the skillet one at a time, and season with salt and pepper.

5. Cook the eggs until the whites are no longer runny, about 3-4 minutes.

6. Sprinkle the shredded cheese over the eggs and bacon.

7. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 3-4 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

8. Serve hot, with bacon and eggs. Enjoy!
\n\nBacon and Egg Lunch Omelet@Tue Dec 0.title: Bacon and Egg Lunch Omelet

\n\nYou-Tastic Lunch Salad@Tue Dec 05 21.recipe:
Ingredients:

-1-2 cups cooked brown or white rice
-½ cup cooked black beans
-1 bell pepper (any color), diced
-1 small onion, diced
-1 tablespoon olive oil
-1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
-salt and pepper, to taste
-½ cup shredded cheese
-¼ cup chopped cilantro

Instructions:

1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.

2. Add the bell pepper and onion and cook until the onion is softened and lightly browned, about 4 minutes.

3. Add the cooked brown or white rice, black beans, cumin, and salt and pepper. Stir until combined and heated through, about 3 minutes.

4. Turn off the heat and top with the shredded cheese and cilantro.

5. Serve warm. Enjoy!
\n\nYou-Tastic Lunch Salad@Tue Dec 05 21.title: You-Tastic Lunch Salad

\n\nYou-Tastic BBQ Bowl@Tue Dec 05 21:25.recipe:
Ingredients: 
- You 
- 2 cups of cooked quinoa 
- 2 carrots, chopped 
- 1 cup of black beans 
- 1 bell pepper, diced 
- 1 tomato, diced 
- 1/2 cup of salsa 
- Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions: 
1. In a medium saucepan, bring 1 cup of cooked quinoa to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 7 minutes, or until quinoa is cooked through. 

2. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook carrots until soft and slightly browned. 

3. Add black beans, bell pepper, and tomato, and cook until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.

4. When quinoa is cooked through, add it to the skillet with the vegetables and stir together.

5. Add salsa to the skillet and season with salt and pepper, to taste. 

6. Serve the quinoa and vegetable mixture and enjoy!
\n\nYou-Tastic BBQ Bowl@Tue Dec 05 21:25.title: You-Tastic BBQ Bowl

\n\nSavory Quinoa with Roasted Tomatoes.recipe:
Ingredients: 
-Potatoes
-Cabbage
-Carrots
-Sauce 

Recipe: 
1. Begin by dicing your potatoes and boiling in a pot on the stove top for 10 minutes. 
2. Shred the cabbage and carrots and add to the boiling potatoes. Cook for an additional 10 minutes.
3. Drain and transfer the vegetables to a mixing bowl.
4. Add in the sauce and mix until everything is evenly combined.
5. Scoop the vegetable mixture into a greased baking dish.
6. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 Fahrenheit for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned. 
7. Enjoy your lunch!
\n\nSavory Quinoa with Roasted Tomatoes.title: Savory Quinoa with Roasted Tomatoes and Chickpeas

\n\nYou-Tastic Veggie Stir-Fry@Tue Dec 0.recipe:
Ingredients:

-1 large sweet potato
-1 cup cooked black beans
-1 bell pepper
-1/4 cup diced red onion
-1/4 cup fresh chopped cilantro
-1 teaspoon ground cumin
-1 teaspoon chili powder
-1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
-Salt and pepper, to taste
-2 tablespoons olive oil

Instructions:

1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.

2. Cut sweet potato into 1/2-inch cubes then combine with bell pepper, red onion, cilantro, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, and salt and pepper in a large bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and stir to combine.

3. Place the mixture onto a baking sheet and spread out evenly. Bake for 15-20 minutes until vegetables are tender.

4. In a separate bowl mix together the cooked black beans, salt, and pepper.

5. Serve the roasted vegetables over the black beans in a bowl and enjoy!
\n\nYou-Tastic Veggie Stir-Fry@Tue Dec 0.title: You-Tastic Veggie Stir-Fry

\n\nYou-Talian Sub Sandwich@Tue Dec 05 2.recipe:
Ingredients:

-2 slices of whole wheat bread
-1/4 cup of hummus
-1/4 cup of diced tomatoes
-1/4 of a red onion, finely diced
-1/4 cup of feta cheese, crumbled
-1/2 tsp of dried oregano
-1/4 cup of olive oil

Instructions:

1. Preheat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat.

2. Toast the slices of bread until lightly browned.

3. Spread the hummus on the slices of bread.

4. Layer the diced tomatoes, onions, feta cheese and oregano over the hummus.

5. Drizzle the olive oil over the top of the vegetables.

6. Place the two slices of bread together and press lightly to make your sandwich.

7. Place the sandwich in the preheated pan and cook until the bottom slice is browned and crisp.

8. Flip the sandwich and cook until the other side is browned and crisp.

9. Cut in half and enjoy!
\n\nYou-Talian Sub Sandwich@Tue Dec 05 2.title: You-Talian Sub Sandwich

\n\nSimple You Lunch Plate@Tue Dec 05 20.recipe:
Ingredients: 
-You
-Medium sweet potato
-1 tablespoon olive oil
-1 cup cooked quinoa
-1/4 cup sundried tomatoes
-1/4 cup black olives
-1/4 cup uncooked chickpeas
-1/2 cup chopped fresh basil

Instructions:

1. Preheat oven to 375°F.

2. Peel and cube the sweet potato. Toss in the olive oil and spread onto a baking sheet. Roast for 25 minutes, or until sweet potatoes are cooked through.

3. While the sweet potatoes are roasting, combine the quinoa, sundried tomatoes, black olives, and chickpeas in a large bowl.

4. Once the sweet potatoes are finished roasting, add them to the bowl with the other ingredients and mix together.

5. Serve the lunch in individual bowls, and top with chopped fresh basil. Enjoy!
\n\nSimple You Lunch Plate@Tue Dec 05 20.title: Simple You Lunch Plate

\n\nYou's Zesty Lemon Chicken Salad@Tue.recipe:
Ingredients

- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 head of cauliflower, chopped into small pieces
- ½ cup roasted pumpkin seeds
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- Salt to taste
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
Instructions

1. Preheat a large skillet over medium-high heat.

2. Add the olive oil to the pan and allow it to heat.

3. Add the cauliflower and stir to coat with the olive oil. Cook for about 2 minutes.

4. Add the pumpkin seeds, cumin, smoked paprika, and salt to the pan and toss to combine. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.

5. Add the cooked quinoa to the pan and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.

6. Serve warm. Enjoy!
\n\nYou's Zesty Lemon Chicken Salad@Tue.title: You's Zesty Lemon Chicken Salad

\n\nSavory You-ni Sandwich@Tue Dec 05 20.recipe:
Ingredients:
-Sliced deli turkey
-Green peppers
-Carrots
-Zucchini
-Lemon juice
-Extra virgin olive oil 
-Smoked paprika 

Instructions:

1. In a bowl, combine the sliced deli turkey, green peppers, carrots, and zucchini.

2. Drizzle the lemon juice and olive oil over the contents of the bowl and mix together. 

3. Season with smoked paprika, then stir until everything is combined.

4. Place the mixture in a medium skillet over low heat and cook until the vegetables have softened, stirring occasionally.

5. Transfer the contents of the skillet to two plates, and serve. Enjoy!
\n\nSavory You-ni Sandwich@Tue Dec 05 20.title: Savory You-ni Sandwich

\n\nYou're Sure to Love This Easy Chicke.recipe:
Ingredients:

-1 potato (diced)
-1 onion (diced)
-1 cup of dark lentils 
-1 garlic clove (minced)
-½ cup of vegetable broth
-1 teaspoon of olive oil 
-1 teaspoon of cumin 
-1 teaspoon of paprika
-1 teaspoon of oregano
-Salt & pepper to taste

Instructions:

1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

2. Add the diced potato and onion and sauté until golden brown, about 5 minutes.

3. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute.

4. Stir in the dark lentils and vegetable broth and season with cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and pepper.

5. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the potatoes and lentils are tender and cooked through.

6. Serve warm with your favorite toppings!
\n\nYou're Sure to Love This Easy Chicke.title: You're Sure to Love This Easy Chicken and Spinach Lunch Bowl

\n\nGreen Lentil Quinoa Bowl@Tue Dec 05.recipe:
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups cooked and cooled chickpeas
1/4 cup plain Greek Yogurt
1/2 cup diced cucumber
1 1/2 teaspoons freshly squeezed lemon juice
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
1 teaspoon oregano
1/4 cup diced red bell pepper
salt and pepper

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the chickpeas, yogurt, cucumber, lemon juice, garlic powder, oregano, and red bell pepper.
2. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Spread out the mixture onto two slices of toasted whole-grain bread.
4. Top one of the slices of bread with the other slice.
5. Cut into two triangles and enjoy!
\n\nGreen Lentil Quinoa Bowl@Tue Dec 05.title: Green Lentil Quinoa Bowl

\n\nSavory Veggie Soba Bowl@Tue Dec 05 2.recipe:
Ingredients:
-Pita Bread 
-Tomato 
-Cucumber 
-Feta Cheese 
-Olive Oil 

Instructions: 
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. 
2. Slice the pita bread into triangles. 
3. Place the pita triangles onto a baking sheet and lightly brush with olive oil. 
4. Bake in preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
5. Meanwhile, in a bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, cucumber, feta cheese, and a drizzle of olive oil. 
6. Serve the pita chips with the tomato cucumber feta topping. Enjoy!
\n\nSavory Veggie Soba Bowl@Tue Dec 05 2.title: Savory Veggie Soba Bowl

\n\nYou's Savoury Sandwich Supper@Tue De.recipe:
Ingredients:

You
1 cup of cheese
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 tablespoons ketchup 
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
1 tablespoon honey
1 clove garlic
2 slices of white bread

Instructions:

1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees.

2. In a bowl, mix together the cheese, olive oil, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, honey, and garlic.

3. Spread the mixture over both slices of bread.

4. Place the slices of bread on a baking sheet.

5. Bake for 15-20 minutes until the cheese has melted and the bread is lightly golden brown.

6. Serve hot. Enjoy!
\n\nYou's Savoury Sandwich Supper@Tue De.title: You's Savoury Sandwich Supper

\n\nCheesy You Combo Sandwich@Tue Dec 05.recipe:
Ingredients:

-Tomatoes
-Spinach
-Shrimp
-Mozzarella cheese
-Garlic

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.

2. Cut the tomatoes into wedges and place them in a baking dish.

3. Place the shrimp on top of the tomatoes.

4. Slice the garlic into thin slices and sprinkle them on top of the shrimp.

5. In a medium bowl, mix together the spinach and mozzarella cheese.

6. Spread the spinach and mozzarella cheese mixture on top of the shrimp and tomatoes.

7. Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 20 minutes.

8. Remove from oven and enjoy your delicious lunch!
\n\nCheesy You Combo Sandwich@Tue Dec 05.title: Cheesy You Combo Sandwich

\n\nYou-licious Veggie Wrap@Tue Dec 05 1.recipe:
Ingredients: 
-1/2 cup cooked quinoa
-1/2 cup broccoli
-1/2 cup carrots
-1/4 cup onions
-1/4 cup mushrooms
-1 tablespoon olive oil
-Garlic powder
-Salt and pepper to taste

Recipe instructions:
1. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
2. Sauté the onions, mushrooms, broccoli, and carrots until lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the cooked quinoa and season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
4. Cook everything together for an additional 5 minutes.
5. Serve warm! Enjoy!
\n\nYou-licious Veggie Wrap@Tue Dec 05 1.title: You-licious Veggie Wrap

\n\nYou-Style Veggie Quinoa Bowl@Tue Dec.recipe:
Ingredients:
You
butter
onion
mushroom
seasoning

Instructions:
1. Begin by heating butter in a skillet over medium heat.
2. Add the onion and mushroom to the butter and season with some salt and pepper. Sauté for about 5 minutes or until the vegetables are soft and tender.
3. Remove the vegetables from the heat and stir in the you for a few minutes until they become lightly browned and fragrant.
4. Serve the you and veggies on a plate and enjoy!
\n\nYou-Style Veggie Quinoa Bowl@Tue Dec.title: You-Style Veggie Quinoa Bowl

\n\nCrispy You Sandwich@Tue Dec 05 19:30.recipe:
Ingredients:

-One slice of whole wheat or sourdough bread 
-One tablespoon of butter
-One tablespoon of cream cheese
-One hard-boiled egg, cut into slices
-One tablespoon of shredded cheddar cheese
-One tablespoon of diced bell pepper
-One handful of spinach
-Salt and pepper, to taste 

Instructions:

1. Spread butter on one side of the bread.
2. Spread cream cheese on the other side of the bread. 
3. Layer the hard-boiled egg, cheddar cheese, bell pepper and spinach onto the slice of bread.
4. Sprinkle salt and pepper over the top. 
5. Place the sandwich on a lightly greased skillet over medium-high heat. Cook until the cheese has melted and the bread has toasted, about 4-5 minutes. 
6. Cut the sandwich in half and enjoy.
\n\nCrispy You Sandwich@Tue Dec 05 19:30.title: Crispy You Sandwich

\n\nHearty You-rrito Bowl@Tue Dec 05 20:.recipe:
Ingredients: 
-2 tablespoons of olive oil
-1 small onion, diced
-1 large carrot, diced
-1 cup of canned beans, such as black, kidney or garbanzos
-1/2 cup diced celery
-1 teaspoon Italian herbs
-Salt and Pepper to taste

Instructions: 
1. Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the diced onion and let it cook for about 5 minutes, or until it begins to turn golden brown.

2. Add the carrot, and let it cook for a few minutes. After it has softened, add the beans, celery, and Italian herbs.

3. Let everything cook together for about 10 minutes, stirring often, until the vegetables are softened and the beans are hot.

4. Season with salt and pepper to taste, then serve as is or over some cooked grains. Enjoy!
\n\nHearty You-rrito Bowl@Tue Dec 05 20:.title: Hearty You-rrito Bowl

\n\nSavory Eggplant Basil Couscous@Tue D.recipe:
Ingredients: 
• 1 can of black beans 
• 1 red bell pepper 
• 1/4 cup of quinoa 
• 1/2 cup of frozen corn 
• 1 tablespoon of olive oil 
• Salt and pepper to taste 

Instructions: 
1. Heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. 
2. When the oil is hot, add the diced bell pepper to the pan and sauté for 3-4 minutes. 
3. Add the black beans and frozen corn to the pan and let them cook for a few minutes until they are heated through. 
4. Add the quinoa and stir to combine. 
5. Season with salt and pepper and enjoy!
\n\nSavory Eggplant Basil Couscous@Tue D.title: Savory Eggplant Basil Couscous

\n\nYou-Made Veggie Wrap@Tue Dec 05 19:0.recipe:
Ingredients:
You 

Instructions:

1. Slice You thinly into strips, or cubes.

2. Heat a pan over medium heat and add some oil.

3. Once the oil is hot, add the You strips or cubes and stirring occasionally. 

4. Cook until the strips and/or cubes are golden brown and cooked through.

5. Transfer the strips or cubes to a plate and season with salt and pepper.

6. Serve with a side of your favorite salad, or other vegetables. Enjoy!
\n\nYou-Made Veggie Wrap@Tue Dec 05 19:0.title: You-Made Veggie Wrap

\n\nScrumptious You-Made Breakfast@Tue D.recipe:
Ingredients:

-You 
-2-3 Eggs
-Milk 
-Salt
-Ground Black pepper 

Recipe:

1. Crack two to three eggs in a bowl and whisk them together.

2. Add a splash of milk to the eggs and mix it together until you get a nice, creamy consistency.

3. Season the mixture with salt and ground black pepper to taste.

4. Heat up a non-stick skillet over medium heat.

5. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet.

6. Let the eggs cook until the edges begin to curl up from the skillet.

7. Flip the eggs over and let them cook for an additional 1-2 minutes. 

8. Serve the delicious breakfast eggs and enjoy!
\n\nScrumptious You-Made Breakfast@Tue D.title: Scrumptious You-Made Breakfast

\n\nTangy Teriyaki Rice Bowl@Tue Dec 05.recipe:
Ingredients:
 1. Potato
 2. Carrot 
 3. Onion
 4. Garlic
 5. Salt
6. Pepper

Instructions:

1. Heat some oil in a pan over medium heat.
2. Add the potatoes, carrots, onions and garlic and season with salt and pepper.
3. Cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are cooked through.
4. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the vegetables to a bowl and set aside.
5. Return the pan to the heat and add a small amount of oil.
6. Add the cooked vegetables to the pan and toss to combine.
7. Cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are golden and lightly crisped.
8. Serve hot, with your favourite side dish. Enjoy!
\n\nTangy Teriyaki Rice Bowl@Tue Dec 05.title: Tangy Teriyaki Rice Bowl

\n\nCheesy Tomato & Basil Grilled Cheese.recipe:
Ingredients:
1 cup cooked Brown Rice
1/2 cup cooked Chickpeas 
1/2 cup cooked Lentils 
1/2 cup Sweetcorn 
1/2 cup Chopped Tomatoes 
1/4 cup Roasted Red Peppers
1/4 cup Olive Oil 
1 tablespoon Balsamic Vinegar 

Instructions:

1. In a medium bowl, combine cooked brown rice, chickpeas, lentils, sweetcorn, chopped tomatoes, and roasted red peppers.

2. In a small bowl, mix the olive oil and balsamic vinegar together until it is combined.

3. Pour the olive oil and balsamic mixture over the rice and vegetables and mix until everything is coated.

4. In a large pan over medium high heat, add the coated rice and vegetables. Stir until everything is well mixed and heated through.

5. Serve the cooked rice and vegetables over a bed of fresh lettuce and enjoy!
\n\nCheesy Tomato & Basil Grilled Cheese.title: Cheesy Tomato & Basil Grilled Cheese

\n\nTomato Egg Skillet@Mon Dec 04 22:24:.recipe:
Ingredients:
1 Tomato
2 Eggs
1/4 teaspoon Salt
1/4 teaspoon Pepper
1 tablespoon Olive Oil

Instructions:
1. Start by heating olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. 
2. Cut the tomato into quarter slices and add them to the skillet. 
3. Cook the tomato slices until lightly browned. 
4. Crack the eggs into a bowl, then add salt and pepper to the eggs. 
5. Add the egg mixture to the skillet and reduce the heat to medium-low. 
6. Stir the egg and tomato until the eggs are cooked and there are no raw egg pieces visible. 
7. Serve the egg and tomato dish hot. Enjoy!
\n\nTomato Egg Skillet@Mon Dec 04 22:24:.title: Tomato Egg Skillet

\n\nBacon and Ham Sandwich@Mon Dec 04 22.recipe:
Ingredients needed:
1-4 slices of Bacon 
1-2 slices of Ham 
2 slices of Bread 
Optional:
Mayonnaise
Mustard

Instructions:
1. Heat up the skillet on medium heat. 
2. Lay the bacon strips in the skillet and cook until both sides are lightly browned. 
3. After the bacon is done, set it aside and add the ham to the same skillet. 
4. Cook the ham until lightly browned, flipping it over once during the cooking process. 
5. Toast the two slices of bread in a toaster or a toaster oven.
6. Assemble the sandwich by spreading a thin layer of mayonnaise and/or mustard (one or both depending on preference) on each slice of bread.
7. Place the bacon and ham on one slice of bread and top it off with the other slice of bread. 
8. Enjoy your bacon and ham sandwich!
\n\nBacon and Ham Sandwich@Mon Dec 04 22.title: Bacon and Ham Sandwich
